intro: Sisymbrium carnosulum, commonly known as the woolly mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, and it produces a strong, pungent odor when crushed. Sisymbrium carnosulum is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within one growing season.
